text: The very first thing I would say is, sorry to hear that you are not having much luck finding work. It can feel very lonely, and I completely understand your frustration but it is fairly normal when you start. Do not give up and keep reapplying, hopefully create new material and try building networks on LinkedIn too. It sometimes takes time, it could be because of a downturn in the industry in Vancouver, a tax break loophole closing etc .... it's very difficult to know. It doesn't mean that you should lose heart or that your work is not good enough!

Looking at your reel, my first impression was that the camera jitters and the RGB channels splitting from time to time do distract from the content. I would keep it simple and give time to the viewer to really see what you have done. Why not have several reels, one snappy one like this and a more traditional one where your work can be seen for longer, in more detail? I'm sure you have plenty of renders to do this.

Do you have any contact with people who have done the same course asyou in previous years? Speak to them to see what kind of issues they faced when graduating too. Is your course finished? Are you out in the world looking for work now? Any chance of doing internship or getting work as a runner?
